elements.title: Buckhounds
elements.contents: ... that when Queen Anne became too infirm to follow her pack of Buckhounds (examples pictured) on horseback, she had paths cut through Windsor Forest so she could follow the hunt in a carriage?

elements.title: John Aitken
elements.contents: ... that John Aitken first discovered oxidative stress as a major cause of male infertility?

elements.title: construct some 57 km (35 mi) of safe cycling routes
elements.contents: ... that the Canadian city of Halifax, Nova Scotia, plans to construct some 57 km (35 mi) of safe cycling routes within its central urban area?

elements.title: Kate Baker
elements.contents: ... that Kate Baker arranged to republish the Australian novel Such Is Life by Joseph Furphy after locating half of the original manuscript under some lumber in the offices of The Bulletin?

elements.title: Homobiles
elements.contents: ... that Homobiles has been called "Uber for drag queens"?

elements.title: Sir Charles Reid
elements.contents: ... that General Sir Charles Reid shot the celebrated, but probably not man-eating, Leeds Tiger?

elements.title: St Gregory's Church, Sudbury
elements.contents: ... that St Gregory's Church, Sudbury, has the mummified head of Archbishop Simon Sudbury, beheaded by a mob in 1381, preserved in a niche in the vestry?

elements.title: Robert Quackenbush
elements.contents: ... that Robert Quackenbush wrote the Henry the Duck books to ease any taunting his son might receive because of his surname?
